message.content:
cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper focuses on the perception of continuity and viewers' observational behavior in VR movies, which are relevant topics in human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and multimedia (cs.MM). The use of gaze data also suggests a potential connection to computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL), as eye-tracking can be used to infer language comprehension. Finally, the paper touches on the topic of spatial misalignments, which could be relevant to graphics (cs.GR).
